sen.e: The official name called in kin-za (an organization in charge of casting and appraising of gold during the Edo period) was ichibu bankin, but it is called ichibu bankin in ancient coin book like Sankazue (Picture Collection of Three Coins: History of Coinage in Japan) and the name 'ichibu bankin' is used widely in currency collecting world and the name 'ichibu kin' spread to distinguish it from Ichibu gin silver coin since the issue of ichibu gin in 1837.
